A cysteine-less form of hASBT was made by creating point mutations at all 13 endogenous cysteines. Cysless hASBT had significantly reduced function correlated with lowered surface expression.Chemical cross-linking of wild-type and Cysless species revealed that hASBT has a dominant negative effect and exists as an active dimer and/or higher order oligomer with apparently no requirement for endogenous cysteine residues.

interpro.desc: Bile acid:sodium symporter/arsenical resistance protein Acr3

name: solute carrier family 10 member 2
other_names: ileal apical sodium-dependent bile acid transporter
solute carrier family 10 (sodium/bile acid cotransporter family), member 2
solute carrier family 10 (sodium/bile acid cotransporter), member 2

reactome.name: Recycling of bile acids and salts
Bile acid and bile salt metabolism

summary: This gene encodes a sodium/bile acid cotransporter. This transporter is the primary mechanism for uptake of intestinal bile acids by apical cells in the distal ileum. Bile acids are the catabolic product of cholesterol metabolism, so this protein is also critical for cholesterol homeostasis. Mutations in this gene cause primary bile acid malabsorption (PBAM); muatations in this gene may also be associated with other diseases of the liver and intestines, such as familial hypertriglyceridemia (FHTG). [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2010].
